017package org.apache.commons.chain.web.jakarta;
018
019import org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog;
020import org.apache.commons.chain.CatalogFactory;
021import org.apache.commons.chain.config.ConfigParser;
022import org.slf4j.Logger;
023import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
024
025import jakarta.servlet.ServletContext;
026import jakarta.servlet.ServletContextEvent;
027import jakarta.servlet.ServletContextListener;
028import jakarta.servlet.ServletException;
029
030/**
031 * {@code ServletContextListener} that automatically
032 * scans chain configuration files in the current web application at
033 * startup time, and exposes the result in a {@link Catalog} under a
034 * specified servlet context attribute. The following <em>context</em> init
035 * parameters are utilized:
036 * <ul>
037 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE</strong> -
038 *     comma-delimited list of chain configuration resources to be loaded
039 *     via {@code ClassLoader.getResource()} calls. If not specified,
040 *     no class loader resources will be loaded.</li>
041 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE</strong> -
042 *     comma-delimited list of chain configuration webapp resources
043 *     to be loaded. If not specified, no web application resources
044 *     will be loaded.</li>
045 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_ATTR</strong> -
046 *     Name of the servlet context attribute under which the
047 *     resulting {@link Catalog} will be created or updated.
048 *     If not specified, it is expected that parsed resources will
049 *     contain {@code &lt;catalog&gt;} elements (which will
050 *     cause registration of the created {@link Catalog}s into
051 *     the {@link CatalogFactory} for this application, and no
052 *     servet context attribute will be created.
053 *     <strong>NOTE</strong> - This parameter is deprecated.</li>
054 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.RULE_SET</strong> -
055 *     Fully qualified class name of a Digester {@code RuleSet}
056 *     implementation to use for parsing configuration resources (this
057 *     class must have a public zero-args constructor). If not defined,
058 *     the standard {@code RuleSet} implementation will be used.</li>
059 * </ul>
060 *
061 * <p>When a web application that has configured this listener is
062 * started, it will acquire the {@link Catalog} under the specified servlet
063 * context attribute key, creating a new one if there is none already there.
064 * This {@link Catalog} will then be populated by scanning configuration
065 * resources from the following sources (loaded in this order):</p>
066 * <ul>
067 * <li>Resources loaded from any {@code META-INF/chain-config.xml}
068 *     resource found in a JAR file in {@code /WEB-INF/lib}.</li>
069 * <li>Resources loaded from specified resource paths from the
070 *     webapp's class loader (via {@code ClassLoader.getResource()}).</li>
071 * <li>Resources loaded from specified resource paths in the web application
072 *     archive (via {@code ServetContext.getResource()}).</li>
073 * </ul>
074 *
075 * <p>If no attribute key is specified, on the other hand, parsed configuration
076 * resources are expected to contain {@code &lt;catalog&gt;} elements,
077 * and the catalogs will be registered with the {@link CatalogFactory}
078 * for this web application.</p>
079 *
080 * <p>This class requires Servlet 2.3 or later. If you are running on
081 * Servlet 2.2 system, consider using {@link ChainServlet} instead.
082 * Note that {@link ChainServlet} uses parameters of the
083 * same names, but they are <em>servlet</em> init parameters instead
084 * of <em>context</em> init parameters. Because of this, you can use
085 * both facilities in the same application, if desired.</p>
086 *
087 * @author Craig R. McClanahan
088 * @author Ted Husted
089 * @version $Revision$ $Date$
090 */
091public class ChainListener implements ServletContextListener {
092
093    // ------------------------------------------------------ Manifest Constants
094
095    /**
096     * The name of the context init parameter containing the name of the
097     * servlet context attribute under which our resulting {@link Catalog}
098     * will be stored.
099     */
100    public static final String CONFIG_ATTR = ChainInit.CONFIG_ATTR;
101
102    /**
103     * The name of the context init parameter containing a comma-delimited
104     * list of class loader resources to be scanned.
105     */
106    public static final String CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE =
107            ChainInit.CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE;
108
109    /**
110     * The name of the context init parameter containing a comma-delimited
111     * list of web application resources to be scanned.
112     */
113    public static final String CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE =
114            ChainInit.CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE;
115
116    /**
117     * The name of the context init parameter containing the fully
118     * qualified class name of the {@code RuleSet} implementation
119     * for configuring our {@link ConfigParser}.
120     */
121    public static final String RULE_SET = ChainInit.RULE_SET;
122
123    // ------------------------------------------------------------ Constructors
124
125    /**
126     * The Default-Constructor for this class.
127     */
128    public ChainListener() {
129    }
130
131    // ------------------------------------------ ServletContextListener Methods
132
133    /**
134     * Remove the configured {@link Catalog} from the servlet context
135     * attributes for this web application.
136     *
137     * @param event {@code ServletContextEvent} to be processed
138     */
139    @Override
140    public void contextDestroyed(ServletContextEvent event) {
141        final ServletContext context = event.getServletContext();
142        ChainInit.destroy(context, context.getInitParameter(CONFIG_ATTR));
143    }
144
145    /**
146     * Scan the required chain configuration resources, assemble the
147     * configured chains into a {@link Catalog}, and expose it as a
148     * servlet context attribute under the specified key.
149     *
150     * @param event {@code ServletContextEvent} to be processed
151     */
152    @Override
153    public void contextInitialized(ServletContextEvent event) {
154        final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(ChainListener.class);
155        logger.info("Initializing chain listener");
156        final ServletContext context = event.getServletContext();
157
158        try {
159            ChainInit.initialize(context, context.getInitParameter(CONFIG_ATTR), logger, true);
160        } catch (ServletException e) {
161            throw new RuntimeException(e);
162        }
163    }
164}
